N.title: Bot detector
N.description:
The maximum number of elements that you want to keep in memory (you can keep millions at a very low cost).

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/authorization/revoking-tokens/

P.title: Probability
P.description:
The probability of returning a false positive. E.g: 0.0000001

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/authorization/revoking-tokens/

HashName.title: Hash function name
HashName.description:
The hash name used. Possible values are  'optimal' (recommended) or 'default'.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/authorization/revoking-tokens/

TTL.title: Time To Live
TTL.description:
The lifespan of the JWT you are generating, in seconds. The value must match the expiration you are setting in the backend.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/authorization/revoking-tokens/

port.title: Port
port.description:
The port number exposed (has to be free) for the RPC service to communicate with the bloomfilter.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/authorization/revoking-tokens/

TokenKeys.title: Token keys
TokenKeys.description:
The list with all the fields in your JWT payload that need watching. These fields establish the criteria to revoke accesses in the future.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/authorization/revoking-tokens/
